Column Comment.0: PROJECT PLAND IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project plan.
Column Comment.1: ALLOWED STEP ID: Unique identifier for a step that is allowed to be included in theproject.
Column Comment.2: ALLOWED STEP ID: Unique identifier for a step that is allowed to be included in theproject.
Column Comment.3: PROJECT PLAN STEP CROSS REFERNCE OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique keyadded to allow steps to be associated more than once, possibly as they change overtime.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: DESCRIPTION: textual description of the work to be completed during this step.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: STEP RULE: a textual description of the rule or condition that must exist for this stepto occur. For example, after a decision is made only one of two possible followingsteps may occur next (one would continue, one would end the process).
Column Comment.12: REFERENCE PROJECT STEP CROSS REFERENCE REASON: describesrelationships between steps in a project. May define necessary precursors, followingsteps, alternate paths etc.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
